newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat closes lower on hedging, corn/soy.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat closes lower on hedging, corn/soy.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures closed lower on hedge selling and on a break in CBOT corn and soybeans, traders said.
"It was a light trade today. Locals were just jockeying back and forth and there was some hedge selling," a trader said.
Benson Quinn sold 1.5 million bushels of September, Country hedging sold 800,000 bushels each of September and December and LFG Futures was a noted seller of September and December, traders said.
Traders said a car (rail car) of new crop spring wheat was expected to arrive Tuesday in Minneapolis.

"We're just waiting for harvest and it's getting started," a trader said. He said the car of wheat was from fields in southeast North Dakota, the yields were roughly 40 bushels per acre and the test weight of the wheat was 60 pounds per bushel.
MGE spring wheat futures closed 6-1/2 to 8-1/2 cents per bushel lower with Septemer down 7-1/2 at $3.84.
MGE spring wheat futures volume was estimated by the MGE at 14,907 contracts, slightly above the 14,303 traded Friday.
Barley futures were unchanged with Sep at $6.20 per cwt.
